page.title: 03Villagers, Eaton B & Edlesbo
page.content: Expansion of the population is having a profound effect on village life. While Totternhoe's population has remained static at around 1500, Edlesborough and Eaton Bray are changing from largely agricultural and motor industry workers to middle class dormitory suburbs. As few, if any, 'starter homes' or council houses have been built in recent years, only the more affluent, and hence, middle- to older- age groups can afford to move in. Young marrieds have to move elsewhere. By 1981, there was already a marked drop in the proportion of 20 to 30 year olds, a fall in the birth-rate to well below the national average, and a reduced demand for early schooling. Conversely, there has been a big increase in those aged 35-65, and many more cars using the narrow roads.
